conclusion: Analyze forces acting on hemispherical bodies A, B, and C.
Bodies A, B, and C are hemispherical and placed on a rough horizontal ground.
Identify forces: weight, normal forces, frictional forces, and contact normal force.
Body C has no frictional force due to smooth surface; only vertical force is weight mg.
Calculate normal force on C: NC = mg.
Frictional force on B is zero due to no horizontal force acting.
Equilibrium conditions for A: sum of forces in x and y directions.
Symmetry implies center of C lies on line joining centers of A and B.
Distance between centers of A and B is 2R; distance between centers of C and A (or B) is R.
Contact forces fAC and fCA are equal due to smooth surfaces.
Net force in x-direction is zero; fAC = fCA = f.
Vertical equilibrium condition for A: NA = mg + fCA + NBA.
Calculate normal force on A: NA = mg(12 + sqrt(3))/6.
Final answer for normal force F on A: F = mg(12 + sqrt(3))/6.
Final answer for frictional force f: f = mg(sqrt(3)/6).
